intro: Teline maderensis subsp. paivae, commonly known as the Maderan alpine bellflower, is a rare and endemic species native to the mountainous regions of Portugal. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its slender stems and clusters of bell-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of blue and violet. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptation to harsh, high-altitude conditions. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, which helps reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
